cohort: All Solid Tumors, Biomarker Testing Compliance (2024–2025)
summary: Significant variation in biomarker testing compliance across cancer types. NSCLC achieves 87% compliance while colorectal lags at 62%, representing $375,000 in untapped precision therapy opportunities.

financial_impact.math: $375,000/year = 11.5% testing gap × 85 targeted therapy candidates × $38,000 margin per patient

clinical_impact.description: Optimizing biomarker testing can significantly improve patient outcomes through precision therapy matching.

metrics.description: Improved progression-free survival with matched therapies
Overall survival benefit with biomarker-matched treatment
Higher objective response rate with matched therapies
Reduced treatment failure rates with precision medicine
Improved quality of life with targeted approaches

peer_comparison.description: Top-performing oncology practices achieve >85% biomarker testing compliance across all tumor types vs. your 75% average, resulting in improved clinical outcomes and financial performance.

financial_impact.math: $520,000/year = $375,000 direct therapy opportunity + $145,000 clinical trial enrollment

action_steps.text: Implement reflex biomarker testing protocols in pathology
Develop cancer-specific biomarker order sets in EHR
Create biomarker compliance dashboard by oncologist
Establish rapid molecular tumor board review process
Create reflex testing protocols for CRC and prostate cancer
Implement biomarker tracking system for oncologists
Establish sample adequacy protocols with pathology

suggestions.text: Consider liquid biopsy program for tissue-limited cases
Analyze turnaround time impact on treatment initiation
